thread.title: Grammys 2017: Adele beats Beyonce to win Song Of The Year
thread.title_full: Grammys 2017: Adele beats Beyonce to win Song Of The Year | English Movie News - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Grammys 2017: Adele beats Beyonce to win Song Of The Year
text:
All eyes were on Adele and Beyonce at the 59th Annual Grammy Music Awards as the two heavyweights were pitted against each other for their songs, 'Hello' and 'Formation' respectively. Well, looks like the British songstress has won this round.
Adele bagged the Song Of The Year award for her chartbuster 'Hello'. Other contenders included Beyonce for 'Formation', Mike Posner for 'I Took A Pill In Ibiza ', Justin Bieber for 'Love Yourself' and Lukas Graham for '7 Years'. With this, Adele has won three awards on her big night.
Adele kicked off this year's Grammys with her powerful rendition of 'Hello'. The 28-year-old later even paid tribute to George Michael. The chart-topping English balladeer was performing Michael 's 'Fastlove' when she fumbled and asked to start over - the second time she has suffered an embarrassment due to technical issues. Adele was tearful at the end of the performance but had the support from the audience of music A-listers, who gave her a standing ovation.
#Grammys : @Adele wins the Song of the Year Award for #Hello pic.twitter.com/70GAkx8ATK
